text: EBC 84 IBU 27. Donkerbruin tot bijna zwart bier met kleine beige schuimkraag. Geur: veel rood fruit, turf, gerookte hesp, kruiden, hout, selderijzout, vanille. Smaak: alcoholisch, zoet, gedroogd fruit, dadels. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitter, wat koffie. Lekker.
Decent, but overrated IMO. Has some of the same sourness and vinegary notes as a Biere Rouge, but somewhat maltier and sweeter.
Very stouty beer. Thick, smoky and filling. Smell: smoked plumes. Taste: roasted dark malt. Aftertaste: bitter chocolate. Very smooth and balanced. Good one.

Very dark black-brown, with red-black highlights if your light is bright enough. Oxidized sherry, tart cherry, whiff of chocolate and treacle. Sweet taste, treacle with a touch of roast, mild bitterness and a trickle of alcoholic warmth. Medium-full body, velvety mouthfeel. Dark, rich and fruity. Entertaining beer, fit for a snifter and a fireside chair.
Its pretty good and I really like the Smokey fruity thing. Nothing special to look at. But it also has a great body and finish.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: dark reddish brown with medium beige head. Aroma: smoke, wood, roasted malts, dark fruits, vanilla, red wine and some soapiness. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of wood, roasted malts, smoke, wry red wine, red fruits and slight coffee. Sticky on the tongue. Finish is long lasting with dark fruits, coffee and smoke. Palate: medium to full bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation.

Aus der Flasche (Special Reserve 2013) 2017-04 getrunken. Das letzte Mal wo ich das hier im Glas hatt sind gut 6 Monate her. Doch der damals sehr dominante Eichenfass- und Rotweineinfluss ist nun in den Hintergrund getreten und die typischen Malznoten sind hervorgetreten. Spannendes Bier auf hohen Nivau. Mal sehen wie es sich weiterentwickel wenn es noch weiterreift.
kurcze mozna tu znalezc naprawde wiele... rodzynki sliwki, aromat beczki, wino, sliwka... i wedzonka... :) super piwko
Creamy off white head, dark brown murky colour. Coffee and prune flavours. Lovely tasting beer, kinda smokey with good carbonation. Real treat.
Zoals een bier van de Struise mogen verwachten. Smaakvol, karaktervolle smaak. zeer lekker biertje

Aromat: mocne uderzenie beczki wina, takie trochę nuty porto, oprócz tego karmel, rodzynki, estrowe nuty.
Wygląd: ciemnobrązowe, piana niewielka, jasnobeżowa, zaraz znika całkowicie, gushing po otwarciu butelki.
Smak: czekolada, rodzynki, suszone owoce- jabłka, śliwki, gruszki, figi. Trochę świeżych owoców, wiśnie, czereśnie, cierpkie nuty wina dobrze kontrujące słodycz, beczka bardzo wyraźna, taniny mocno i wyraźnie czuć na języku, goryczka niewielka. Piwo raczej wytrawne, co prawda jest sporo czekolady i karmelu, ale nuty wina i taniny od beczki, mocno to balansują, wysycenie średnie ale lekko szczypie. Przez nuty winne pije się dosyć lekko, smaczne piwo.

Bottle from vintage 2013. Dark brown colour, almost black, head quickly disappears. Aroma is much raisin, wood, cane sugar, a bit of red wine and barrel. Alcohol does not disturb. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Fizzy carbonation. Very good.

From a 33 cl bottle at Rose Red in Bruges it is a dark Bicol a color with a tan heady he aroma is dark black licorice and raisins. The taste is smoked with hints of raisins and prunes and has a deep rich licorice finish.
From a 33 cl bottle at Rose Red in Bruges. Pours black tan head. Aroma of caramel and raisins. Flavors of oak, prunes and a bit of sour red wine.

Aroma: dried fruits, prunes, alchohol.
Appearance: Dark with a small brown head.
Taste: Burnt malt, dried fruits, prunes, in the aftertaste a small sweetness that turns into a little bitterness
Palate: Dense, small carbonization, long aftertaste

Shared bottle. Aroma: Bit of soy sauce, fruit, dried fruit, caramel. Appearance: Dark ruby body, low head. Taste: Fruit, honey, light soy sauce, a bit watery, some wine notes. Palate: Medium-high body, medium carbonation, sweet finish.

Bottle at home, Nivala. Thanks to JefVerstraete! Vntage 2013. Colour is clear reddish brown with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Dry fruits, ripe fruits, plums, chocolate, vanilla, some vineous elements and malts. Very good.
Chocolate, frutos secos, vino tinto o especiado (vermú) con un final amargo de la madera quemada del barril que queda hasta el regusto. Densa, compleja y bien equilibrada.

Bottle. Pours pitch hazy dark brown with a small light brown head. Aromas of dark fruits, toffee, bread, some vinous notes. Taste is bready, sweet dark fruits, light smoke, vinous notes, light acidity.

Refrigerated 33 cl brown 2013 bottle poured into a Trappist glass. Dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is dark fruit (mostly dates), medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is dates, figs, oak, some red wine, and hints of alcohol. Nice beer.

Dark brown with a discrete head. Medium carbonation. Aroma comes with caramel, bourbon vanilla, wood, licorice, raisins, coffee blend with a dash of smoke. Could be better. 

Bottle: 330ml

Bottle with thanks to Alen! Pours clear reddish chestnut, medium creamy tan head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is smoky, malty, raisins, belgian yeast spiciness, dates, toffee. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, lightly smoky, vinous notes and oak tannins take a backseat to dark dried fruits and belgian spice. Medium body.

Bottle 0.33l at home Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Pour it brown color with no head. Aroma chocolate, licorice and candy sugar. Taste nice chocolate, raisins, sweet candy sugar, pinch of molasis, smoke just little bit, woody, nice balanced, medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 Botella 33 cl en el Lupulo. Embotellado en 15..01..2016. Vintaje 2013. (r256). Color oscuro casi negro con espuma beige oscuro Sabores maltas tostadas algo caramelizadas. Toques de caramelos ligeramente quemados, regaliz y algo de cacao. Cuerpo intenso algo denso y espumoso con suave amargo final. 10 vol. Bastante buena. Para repetir sin duda.
Bottle. Dark brown color, light brown head. Aroma of punes, dates, burnt coffee. Taste is smoky burnt dark fruit, raisins. Tasty.
Donker, kastanjebruin bier met lichtbruine medium kraag. Aroma van koffie, mout, karamel, basterdsuiker, rozijn, druif. Zoet, licht bitter. Volle body, licht prikkelend co2.

Deep brown with tiny, light brown head. Chocolate, wood, malty, yeasty. Deep, dark fruits in the background - plums, prunes, raisins. Moderate to light heavy sweet, broken by some bitterness in the end. Medium body, watery to oily texture, extremely drinkable. In general good brew, highly drinkable, body should be thicker and fuller.

Pours a deep copper-brown with a soft off white head. Roasty and light smoked malt aroma. Sweet malty lightly boozy light winey grape notes and a moderate scotch like smoked character. Soft texture. 

Notes '13 vintage bottle from the shop in Bruges, opened Mar '17. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very good Strong Belgian Ale. I really like the Struise Brewers (although I wouldnt count this as one of their bests).

Zwart kleurig bier met een kleine crème kleurige schuimkraag.

Aroma: leer, tabak, geroosterd, klein beetje rode wijn.

Smaak: karamel, wat donker en wat rood fruit komend van de rode wijn, rook, tabak.

Alcohol goed verborgen, redelijk veel koolzuur en een klein bittertje. 

Lekker.

Struise Blue Monk Special Reserve, czyli Quadrupel leżakowany 3 lata w beczkach po winie. 

Generalnie moje doświadczenia ze Struisem to same bardzo dobre, choć nie zawsze wybitne piwa. Jest też jeden wyjątek potwierdzający regułę, czyli Imperialist. Ale do rzeczy. 

Wygląda jak widać :P Nie ma się co tu nad tym rozwodzić. Piana opada szybko i nic z niej nie zostaje, no ale umówmy się, nie o pianę w tym piwie chodzi. 

Zapach słodkiego wina, suszone śliwki, daktyle, generalnie suszone ciemne owoce, aż momentami wrażenie lekkiej wędzonki od tych suszonych owoców, lekki zapach wina z czarnych porzeczek, słodycz, trochę opiekanych zapachów, lekkie belgijsko-fenolowe przyprawy, ale naprawdę lekkie. Bardzo bogaty aromat. 

W smaku równie bogate. Typowy Quad w stronę suszonych owoców, przypraw jest mniej, ale wyczuwalne. Słodkie, ale nie bardzo pełne. Lekkie posmaki winne również obecne. Trochę opiekania i tej wędzonki od suszonych owoców. Wysycenie nie za wysokie. Ogólnie petarda.

Piwo pokazuje klasę browaru i ogólnie nudnej Belgii. Dzieje się tu sporo, do tego dodatek beczki fajnie się komponuje, nie jest to przesadzone w żadną stronę. Wg mnie zajebiste piwo, ale ma jedną wadę, jest zbyt pijalne i za szybko się kończy :P

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy ruby colored with a small beige head.
Sweet and light roasted aroma of caramel and spices.
Light roasted flavor of caramel and spices.
Fruity finish.

Sweet malty aroma and taste with notes of chocolate, some caramel and fudge notes, a plethora of dark dried fruit, brown sugar, nice spices into the close. Lovely.
33 cl. Bottle. A dark brown coloured beer with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, dried fruit, spice, oak, vanilla yeast and bitterness.

Dark brown pour with medium, frothy, tan head. Pour retention, nice lacing. Intense aromas of dark malts, oak barrel, tobacco, plums. Flavours of dark, dried fruits and caramel, smoked wood, resins, red wine and some phenols. Lingering malty, ashy aftertaste. Full bodied, vinous texture, low carbonation levels. Amazingly complex and delicious beer.
Bottle purchased @ La caisse de bières. Très bel équilibre avec des notes de fruits rouges avec un arrière goût boisé. Belle rondeur.

Bottle, 330 ml from Beergium, shared with JFK10000, Max and Domagoj. Pours brown with small tan head. Caramel, dried fruit, ripe fruit, yeast, spices, some wood. Average carbonation, sweet. Medium to full bodied.

Bottle 330ml. @ Nüetnigenough, Rue du Lombard 25, Brussels, Belgium 1000. [ As Struise Blue Monk Special Reserve ].Clear dark brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, dark malt, moderate to heavy yeasty, riped dark fruit, dark fruit, raisin, plum, prunes, wood. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, dark malt, dark fruit, plum, raison, riped fruit, belgium yeast, wood. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160916]
 7-4-8-3-16

Ar: Fig, blueberry jam, treacle, tobacco, licorice, and cocoa; deep caramel and fig really stand out. Ap: Dark brown; small tan head with low retention, leaves a ring of fine bubbles and a few tiny colonies of foam. T: Sweet fig and tobacco up front; dense burnt caramel and raisin; cocoa, toffee, and nougat; clean, warming alcohol, somewhat rosy in flavor; bitterness is very low, with a slight herbal flavor; finish is clean booze, figs, and rich toasted malt. P: Medium-full body with high carbonation; finish is medium. O: This drink is an absolute pleasure; amazing depth of flavor, combing dark fruit esters with complex caramel notes and tons of refined spice accents; rich and alcoholic to the core, yet eminently drinkable.

0,33 l bottle 
What - a - beer! Wow. 
smoke, alcohol, dried fruits / plum, roasty, raisin, some hints of Islay Whisky, brown, hazy, minimal / no foam head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, full body, sticky, oily feel, soft carbonation / almost flat - but who needs carbo with this beer ? very long finish,

Bottled at Haket, Göteborg, on March 1, 2017.Clear dark brown color, small tan head. Malty, sweet, a tad smoke, evident alcohol scent. Dark fruits, sweet, some smoke, lots of alcohol taste. Malty and alcohol aftertate. Medium mouthfeel, medium to medium low bitterness. Alcohol comes through in a disturbing way for me, others that sampeld the same beer enjoyed it a lot, just not my beer this one.

Drinking from a 33 cl bottle. 
In the aroma alcohol, caramel, smoke and chocolate. 
The clear black beer has a small off white head. 
In the taste chocolate, coffee beans. 
Medium carbonated.
Bottle at home. Pours pitch black with no head. Smoked plums, raisins, dark sugar, pleasent bitterness. Alcohol well hidden hints of smoke. Very interesting brew. I like it a lot. Excellent.

Pours dark amber with a brownish head that doesnt stay for long. Aroma has sweet caramel, candy sugar, spice, fruits and is indeed wineish. Taste is sweetish, caramel, spicy, a bit roasty, sugary, fruity, woody.

Bottle. Pitch black with a fading beige bubbly head. Aroma is of nuts, figs, raisins, plums, dark grapes, caramel. Taste is of treacle, plum, chocolate, dark grapes, nuts, raisins, dates. Sticky syrupy mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bottled from BierNavigatie.nl. Dark brown colored, small beige head. Powerful aged nose, portwine, raisins, fruit, lots of wood, caramel. Malty aged flavor, red wine shining through, wood, caramel, hint of smoke. Relatively thin mouthfeel. Very complex beer, almost overwhelming, but it tastes as if it has been aged for a long, perhaps too long, period of time. I like the intense red wine flavor, but 3 years of aging has been a bit too long for the base beer.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 This goes to my top Belgian list without doubt! Its too tasty! Pours dark brown with a minimal head, showing carbonation. Aroma is very rich, with wood, caramel, dark fruits, spices and red wine tannin. Nice carbonation on the palate, smooth and full body. Gets a lot of wood and red wine (they use serious barrels from Château Haut Breton Larigaudière in Margaux, not a joke!), spices, caramel, dark fruits and some notes of vanilla. The after taste reminds of a BA Imperial Stout. Basically... fantastic!

Dark brown (almost black) with a thin tan head. Savory & sweet aromas of smoked meats & dried fruits. Flavors are similar with salty, smoky notes dominating on arrival (comparable to a rauchbier); tannic red wine notes in the middle; finishes with a bit of roasted nuts. Warms up with a bit of dried herbs adding to the savoriness. Medium body & carbonation, finishing super dry & tannic just like wine. Overall, its like eating a piece of beef jerky alongside some wine. I went into this blind without knowing anything about its aging method or tasting notes. Its a surprise to find such strange flavor combos in this style of beer, so its definitely interesting. Im assuming it lost a lot of its flavor complexity since the three years its been bottled.

Aroma has some greetings from that oak barrel.
Taste is slight sour, caramel, some spices, some smoke. Medium sweet, almost no bitterness. Balanced, interesting.

Javais mis beaucoup despoir dans cette bière, on la cherchée pour moi .. et quand je la découvre,
je la trouve bien au-delà de sa réputation .. Mais le monde de la bière est ainsi fait !!
Le brasseur la définit comme une "dark strong ale".
Niveau abv de 10 %, pour 27 ebu.
Couleur roux auburn sombre (ebc 84), à la clarté nette.
Mousse qui est un nappage diaphane de surface.
Arômes de malt cara, choco, vin rouge pas trop engageant, pointe de chou rouge.
1ère bouche souple avec malt torréfié, vin rouge, poireau, tanin vif.
Arrière-bouche sur de la betterave rouge, câpres, pointe de genièvre.
2ème sur un vin de petite gamme, pâte de fruits rouges, airelles.
Arrière-bouche sans vraie harmonie.
3ème avec du vin, mais sans lien au malt.
Arrière-bouche sur un vin perdu, plutôt genre vin chaud dhiver.
Longueur assez imprécise, sans vrai relief .. une vague nuance de quad, mais avec du lard fumé !!
Jambes grasses, longues.
Levure boisée, ligne correcte.
Alcool fort, mais il est bien à la peine dans ce mélange hétéroclite.
Finale faible.
CONCLUSION : la bière est complètement faussée par le vin .. elle pouvait être valable en-dessous,
mais elle a perdu toute direction avec la barrelisation !!! Le moine bleu a été tué par le tonneau de
vin .. priez pour lui !!!
Bottle. Brown color with tanned head. Aroma has oak, dark fruits, berries. Taste is malty with quite long a bit sweet and just a little sour aftertaste. Flavors of dark fruits, oak, malt, berries.
Apple or Apple cider Aroma covered by a smoked blanket. Initial smoky taste. Full body but low carbonation.
Mousse trop faible. Arôme fruité (pomme cerise)et fumé. Bien onctueuse. Gout légèrement fumée.bonne bière mais traître, on ne sent pas les 10%.

Bottle. Poured dark reddish/brown color with an average tan frothy head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Medium to heavy complex dark fruit, wood, caramel and alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy complex dark fruit smoke sweet flavor with medium to heavy dark fruit sweet finish and a bite of alcohol of long duration. Standout brew.

330ml bottle. Pours dark brown with small bubbly golden head, stays okay. Aroma is nutty, fruity, bready, cherry, some brandy, woody. Taste is rich, nutty, woody, brandy, some jägermeister, herbal notes, prunes. Long aftertaste with hoppy notes and warming alcohol. Almost full bodied, but still surprisingly easily drinkable, medium carbonated. Very good winter warmer!

Bottle brought back from a trip to Bruges. Pours deep brown with a beige head. Nice fruity aroma with sherry, coffee, dried fruits and caramel. The taste has more of the same along with soy, brown sugar, a fair bit of spice and red wine coming through increasingly in the finish. Nice one.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Wow. Karmel, melasa, czerwone wino, wanilia, dębina, wiśnie, figi. Super.

Dark amber, small head, disappearing after while. Aroma: belgian fruits, plums, fig, wood and spices (pine?). Heavy body, heavy cloying sweetness, low bitterness. Malty flavour, fruits, dry fruits, some vanilla and yeasts. Bit alcoholic finish, but it fits to rest. Palpable barrel notes. Overall vey heavy but balanced.
After warming lots of cherries.

11.2 ounce bottle poured into a tulip glass. The beer is a near black with a beige head of foam. Good head retention. In the aroma I get notes of cocoa powder, wet wood, sugar doughnuts, some nutty notes. The taste has a great nut and chocolate sweetness. As the beer warms, I start to notice more of the wine barrels. I get a nuance of a dry red. Some spice notes come through as well. Such a complex beer, with a multitude of layers of flavors. The body of the beer is on the high end, with a thick, chewy mouthfeel. Carbonation is higher than I would have expected. Its on the high end of medium. Not like a bubble explosion in the mouth, but spritzy on the tongue, for sure. A beautiful beer. Something I wish I could get more easily.

Pours ruby brown with a thin k brown head that dissipates to a quarter-inch head. Aromas of dark fruit and toffee. Flavors of raisin, plum, toffee, chocolate, coffee and smokiness. Clean mouthfeel. Really delicious.

W aromacie na pocz?tku wyraznie melano. Potem czerwone wino i lekka wanilia. Troche czekolady, chleba, nuta alkoholowa oraz miód. Barwa br?zowo -czerwona, nieprzejrzysta z be?owa pian?. Niestety niezbyt trwa?a. G?sta, oleista konsystencja. W smaku s?odycz z?amana kwaskowoscia, melano, czekolada, alkohol, nuty winne z musnieciem wanilii. Po chwili ca?o?? staje si? bardziej wytrawna. Goryczka slodowo - alkoholowa momentami przytlacza. Tega pelnia umiarkowane wysycenie i kwaskowo-alkoholowy finisz. Wyrazne akcenty wina, ale i wytrwale s?ody. Sporo cia?a. Niezle.

Geweldig prachtig onbeschrijfbaar aroma van hout en kersen. Alsof je de wijn ruit die in vaten heeft gezeten. Donker zwart rood, met een mooie creme caramel kleurige schuimkraag. Een bier met een geweldige smaak evolutie. Een zachte afdronk die rokerig is en die zich lang maar prachtig doortrekt. Een mooie spice aanwezig in de lange afdronk. Komt vol en zacht bruisend binnen een ware explosie aan smaken espresso, kersen, gebrande noten, caramel. Het is verweven in een machtig mooi geheel. Chapeau!!!!

Hazelnut colour with a foamy light brown head. After a minute a small film of foam lingers. Aroma: Caramel, malt, smoky whiskey and fruit. Taste is dominated by smoke and sweet with a bitter, smoky aftertaste. Oily with medium low carbonation. Good, bu t i prefer the original Pannepot

(Bottle, 0.33 l - vintage 2013, at One Pint Pub, 20161216) The beer poured dark brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and nearly white. Aroma had dried plums, raisins,  caramel and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, caramel, dried plums, toffee, toasted malts, sweetness, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste had sweetness, caramel and bitterness. A very sweet brew with drying yeast notes.
Deep brown, cloudy. Off-white head. Good lacing. Lots of dried fruit, caramel, some smoke, yeast. Similar taste. Medium body. Splendid quality. No hook.

A real array of sensations in the mouth working on all sections of the palette. Not as smoky as some of the other stouts, it definitely benefited from aging in the oak wine bottles.
Would buy a case if I had a chance.
Dat dit bier heeft gerijpt op rode wijnvaten komt goed naar voren, maar toch subtiel genoeg. Aroma heeft iets fruitigs en houtigs. Smaakt lekker zoet en een beetje gebrand.
Bottle, thanks to Mike. Pours a hazed brown with a medium sized tan head. Soft wood, bourbon, warm and boozy. Medium bodied, warm and boozy. Warm and roasty, wood and booze.

Shared 33cl bottle. Pours almost black with a fizzy beige head. Aroma of caramel malt, spice, dark fruits, red wine and smoky notes. Taste follows nose with some chocolate, wood and alcohol. Very good.

Bottle at 20th Pizza Port Strong Ale Festival. Pours dark brown with a medium, creamy beige head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy bready malt, figs and plums, dark Candi sugar, spices and moist fruitcake. Flavor is moderate bready malt, fruitcake in liquid form with spices and a sweet, lightly tart finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Very clear dark brown with dark amber tints. Head is low beige that dissipates.
Aroma is sweet, molasses, caramel, soy sauce notes, caramel, burnt roasted malts, sweet wood (vanilla?), maybe some smoke notes and some cream notes. Taste follows nose. Its sweet, dark bread crust, caramel, some roasted notes, some light roasted malts too (nutty), very complex. Finish is dark malts and a hint of bitterness with quite long warm aftertaste. A beautifully malty brew with balanced wood character. Low carbonation, medium to full body

Along with Yves at home philip black colored body with a off white head and a roasted malt fruity alcholic aroma a roasted malt chocolate caramel alcholic fruity bitter sweet taste with a alcholic bitter finish
Shared with wim at phils place. Dark brown colored beer with small white head and no carbonation. Fruited malty aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet fruited malty bit roasted.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Dark ruby-brown, beige head. Aroma starts with a cherry pie and almonds, followed by spicy red wine and oakwood smokiness. The flavour is a nice blend of slightly sweet dark malts, dry spicy red wine on a lightly roasty stouty base. Light, slightly smoky and spicy bitter finish. Nice easy-drinking mouthfeel. Excellent.

Aroma: lots of red wine, a little boozy, even a little smoky; Appearance: black with thin white head that disappears; Taste: follows nose with lots of complexity; what a huge beer; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet and smoky finish; Overall: delicious; would get again if available.

2013.
Beautiful rich dark brown colour with a vibrrant tan head. Smooth dense sappy like body with some acidity poking through. Prunes, pear drop, smoke, nuts and chocolate on the palate with a spicy almost cherry-ish spiciness just zinging through. Tannic but gives real joy too.
Very impressive now but its obvious this was built for long haul greatness and when it hits its peak Blue Monk will make most other legendary beers look like run of the mill. 
Cannot wait to try again in a couple years time.

33cl bottle at home from Biernavigatie.nl. Bottled on 12.10.2013. Nose is fruity, dark berries, honey, caramel, biscuits. Body is non-transparent, nearly black, head is medium, beige, creamy, average lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is dried fruits, caramel, milk chocolate, raisin, roasted malt. Heavy sweet, medium bitter, medium fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity roasty medium bittersweet, chocolate notes, light alcohol warmth. Full body, slick texture, average carbonation. Quite heavy due to sweetness and a bit too sweet for me but a fantastic piece of this style, strong flavor, rich aroma, exciting, nice one.

Aroma is stuffed with raisins, prunes, vanilla and dark malts. Taste is soft and gentle despite the ABV, caramelly notes, sweet dark bread, sticky sweet dark fruits and that characteristic Belgian yeast notes. Well balanced and all, but still a warming alcohol sensation in the end. Not as elegant as you might think, but still a really good Belgian beer.

Vintage 2013. BA in red wine barrels. Hmm. Cudowny zapach winny, balsamiczny, przypominal mi fiolki w ogrodzie, a takze wlokna kokosowe. Wyglad to srednia piana dwufazowa jakby bezowa i sniezno biala w malym fragmencie, ciemno brazowa barwa. Struktora oleista, melasa, ciemny gryczany miod, mnostwo jagod, jezyn, wisni i czerwonycg gron. Bardzo rozbudowane piwo zarowno w aromaci (bardziej) jak i w smaku). Z poczatku moze przestraszyc zbytnia slodkosc, ale szybko ustepuje i pojawia sie winna taniczna wytrawnosc. Super piwo, a na koniec dostajemy rozgrzewajace cieplo szklachetnego alkoholu. Doskonale, ale do delektowania sie w rozsadnych ilosciach. Perfect quadrupel.

At a tasting, thanks, almost no head, cloudy deep brown color with reddish taints, aroma of caramel, smoke, beef jerky like and candy, flavor of caramel, dark fruits and a whiff of smoke, light pleasant sourness, quite strong But mellow sweetness. Very nice.

Flesje gedeeld met TomHendriksen. Diep donkerbruin helder bier met een rode gloed. Aroma is fruitig, houtig en caramelachtig. Smaak is zoet fruitig (rood fruit), kruidig en caramelachtig en nootachtig. Ook komt de rijping op het wijnvat duidelijk tot zn recht. Bier om rustig van te genieten. Jammer dat de smaak iets te vlug weg ebt.

Fles gedeeld door Inoven. Het is een donkere bruine quadrupel met een rode gloed en een kleine bruine schuimkraag. In de smaak en reuk komt de wijn goed naar voren, maar ook het gebrande hout is lekker aanwezig. Het heeft een kruidige maar toch ook fruitige smaak.

Bottle. Dark brown color, almost no foam. Very rich aroma: wine, vanilla, bourbon, butter, raisins, dried figs, sherry, dried fruit. Taste: strong, sherry and bourbon barrel, dried fruit, vanilla, raisins. Just very good!

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Viel fassiges Sherryobstflair mit schlanker Kopfnote. Der Trunk leicht ölig mit starken Quadrupelverweisen. Sehr speziell der vom Alkohol befeuerte, Röstbrandgeschmack im Nachtrunk. Der abgerundete, stark verfasstweinte Bruder. Geil!!! 0,33l Flasche vim FINESTBELGIANBEER Online Shop. Ca. 4. Vintage 2013.

Piana nieduża, sycząca, szybko znikająca do firanki. Barwa brązowo rubinowa, opalizującna, zbity osad drożdżowy na dnie butelki. W aromacie słodko, sporo tu kandyzowanego cukru, karmelu, rodzynek i daktyli, w tle delikatna ziołowość, przyprawowość, miód spadziowy, wosk pszczeli, wanilia... W smaku dość słodko, mamy powtórkę z zapachu plus karmel, do tego lekka kwaskowość czerwonego wina, kandyzowanych moreli, pikantność czerwonego pieprzu i odrobina tanin w postaci starego drewna. W posmakach pojawia się nawet delikatna paloność?! Goryczka niska, ziołowo pestkowa, niskie wysycenie, dość gęste, wyklejające, treściwe i niezwykle ułożone.

Cudownie gładkie i zbalansowane Belgian Strong Ale, bardzo zawiesiste, intensywne, z ciekawym wpływem beczki i ładnie schowanym alkoholem. Piwo do powolnego sączenia i delektowania się...

Very dark ruby colour, almost black. Small off white head. Aroma of dark fruits, cherries, vanilla, toast, raisin, cognac. Taste is light to medium sweet, slightly tart, perfectly balanced. Medium body, oily to creamy texture, average to lively carbonation. 2013 Reserva. Very, very tasty!
0,33l bottle from Beergium. Aroma of malts, yeast, caramel, syrup, smoke, wood, fruit. Sweet, smoky and a bit bittery taste, above medium body. Not alcoholy at all.

Bottled. 33cl sample. The aroma has raisin, caramel, orange peel, cinnamon and clove. Bit hazy, brown coloured beer with a medium sized off-white head. The taste is light bitter and sweet and has caramel sweetness, dried fruit, spice. Bit sticky, medium-full bodied.
Pours hazy brown with tan head. Caramel, syrup, ripe fruits and cake. Flavour is medium to heavy sweet, light to medium bitter, toasted, fruity and cake.

From 330 ml bottle. Thanks Stellios! Dark copper brown color with beige head. Malty and light yeasty aroma, caramel, some roasted malty notes, chocolate, dark dried fruits, light wood, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.

On Draught, the keg jyst says "Struise Blue Monk Special Reserve (2013)" & mentions nothing about "Barrel Strength" or whatever, so I guess even though its not bottled... Ill rate it here.
Pours a dark brown with mahogany hues where the light penetrates. The head is small & there is a bit of spotty lacing on the glass. 

Aroma is chocolaty & a little oaky w/ dark fruit & light roast. 

Flavor is sort of Christmas spice like with some oak & light booze plum & light chocolate. 
Rich & delicious

Bottle @Bir&Fud (Rome). Pours deep amber/brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, brown sugar, licorice, port wine, raisins, candied fruits. Flavour is medium to heavy sweet with a decent bitter end and very light sourness, milk. Full body, medium carbonation. Rich and powerful.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks Yoav. Cloudy brown with beige head. The aroma is yeasty and smoked with some wood, raisin, vanilla and liqueur. Sweet flavor with notes of raisin, smoked, wood, some vanilla and liqueur, alcoholic. Sticky, full-bodied. Very good.

Robe brune dense, fine mousse crémeuse. Nez sur des notes fumées, de la couenne de lard, évolue vers les "levures struise", le chocolat noir, le malt torréfié, puissant et complexe. Bouche à lattaque à la fois ample et suave, une bulle fine et enrobée, un coté crémeux, mais frais, une longue finale torréfiée et fumée. Une bière dhiver, à siroter au coin du feu.

Onbekend pareltje van struisse. Wordt gebrouwen voor een bevriend café in Amerika. Lijkt op de pannenpot, wellicht met minder anijs en iets zuurder. Desondanks sterk zoet, romig met een zware afdronk. Licht koffie. Erg lekker.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks Yoav. Dark brown with a beige head. Nice aroma of caramel, dark fruits, yeast, some smokiness, mild roast, a bit of chocolate, a bit of wood, nutty note. Sweet flavor with caramel, dark fruits, yeast, brown sugar, a bit of wood, roasty hint. Medium to full-bodied, rounded. Good.

Botella de @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 08/10/2016.
Color marron, sabor maltoso, dulce, cuerpo denso, buena cerveza.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Dark brown colour with a tan head.
Aroma: Caramel, sweet malt, yeast, dried fruit, some spices.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, malt, fruit, yeast.

September 2016 - Bottle share at Leightons, with thanks to Matteo. As Struise Blue Monk Special Reserve, 2013 vintage, 10%. Dark brown, red hue, pretty much opaque, foamy brown head, dotted lacing. Aroma is smoked meats, BBQ sauce on a smoked sausage. Body is smooth with tingly carbonation. Taste follows aroma with its sweet n smokey vibe. Toffee sweet and sugary with a deep smoked ham vibe that instantly reminds me of the Schlenkerla Urbock. A tasty sipper. (3.8)

Svart/röd, glänsande brunt skum. Doft: Söt kryddat råg julbröd, blåbär, likör pralin, lakrits, bröstsocker. Smak: Mörkt råg bröd (typ karlssons fyrkant), alkohol, likör pralin, malt, bröstsocker, lite torkad frukt och mjölkchoklad.

Look: dark brown with dark red shades.

Aroma: sweet, chees with jam, sweet wine, light earthy and woody notes.
Taste: sweet with some sourness.
Flavour: candied fruits, some fat smoked notes, wood, sherry.
Finish is less sweet with light spicy bitterness.

Rich and complex. perfect.

33cl bottle shared at Leightons garbage share. Sourced via Etre. It pours a clean copper color with a medium beige head. Aroma is sweet malty and smoky with notes of caramel, ashes and sea ropes. Taste is also rich sweet and smokey with notes of sea ropes, vanilla, caramel, bourbon notes. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very nice

Bottle shared at Leightons gaff , 19/09/2016. Many thanks to Matteo for this one. A clear chestnut brown coloured pour with a lasting mid tan head. Aroma is meaty glazed ham, mild smoked malts, boozy fruit cake, Belgian quad yeast. Flavour is composed of semi sweet complex malts, nutty, rich fruit cake, sherry. Palate is semi sweet, medium full bodied, highish carbonation. I like it.

Bottle thanks to Matteo at LKS. it pours deep brown with a small off-white head. The aroma is rich, sweet, juicy, smokey, dried fruits, candy, fruit cake, toasty sugars, fig, stewed plum, wood and vanilla. The taste is smooth, rich, sweet, spicy, smoke, meaty, earth, salted plum, ume, dried fruits, fruit cake, vanilla, earth, wood and some warming alcohol with a pretty dry finish. Full body and fine carbonation. Interesting and good fun.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Matteo. Pours clear amber with a frothy, tan head. The nose holds meaty malts, smoked ham, toffee. Medium to heavy sweet flavour with light earthy bitterness, smoked meats, more ham, ripe berries, more toffee. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming in the finish, sticky sweet, with lots more toffee, smoked meat. Good stuff.

Bottle split at Bespin, thanks to Matteo, 19/09/16.
Chestnut brown with a decent beige swirl.
Nose is sweet malts, toffee, light spice, candied fruit peel, nutty, light varnish, hint of smoke.
Taste comprises rich fruit cake, sweet malts, spice, toffee fudge, lightly smoked edge, caramel, brown bread, toasted brown sugars.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in the close.
Decent strong, well balanced for the ABV.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at home, dark brown beer, small head. Aroma is dark fruit, Taste is dark fruit, liquorice, chocolate, malt. nice one

Bottle from Willems. It pours dark ruby brown with a small beige head. The aroma is ripe fruity with a whiff of smoke. Dates and prunes. Molasses. Quite sweet sticky flavor with lots of ripe fruity notes. Marmalade and again a wife of bonfire smoke. Light by sweet fruity finish. To the sweet side but no sign of alcohol as such.

Come sempre, le strong Ale di Struise sono fantastiche. Sentori liquorosi, legnosi, frutta secca, caramello, panettone, marzapane (sia al naso che in bocca). Veramente un capolavoro!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka. Z informacji na etykiecie wynika, że butelkowane zostało 15.01.16. Barwa ciemno brunatna. Piana niewysokiej wielkości, zbita, szybko redukuje się do zera. Aromat mało intensywny, chlebowy, surowego ciasta, lekko owocowy i ziołowy. Smak znacznie wyraźniejszy. Przewaga chleba, surowego ciasta, miodu gryczanego nad owocowa i ziołami. Wysycenie średnie. Goryczka niska. Alkohol dobrze ukryty chodź pod koniec lekko gryzie w przełyk. Pełne, treściwe. Jak na Top50 oczekiwania były zdecydowanie wyższe. Owoce praktycznie niewyczuwalne.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass; 2013 vintage bottled on 10/12/2013. Pours opaque dark brown color with a 2 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of huge raisin, plum, cherry, fig, date, apple, red grape, licorice, pepper, clove, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, light chocolate/nuttiness, oak, red wine, vanilla, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, dark/bready malt, and light-moderate wine barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of huge raisin, plum, cherry, fig, date, apple, red grape, licorice, pepper, clove, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, light chocolate/nuttiness, oak, red wine, vanilla, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Light yeast/tannic oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark fruit, licorice, pepper, clove, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, light chocolate/nuttiness, oak, red wine, vanilla, and yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, dark/bready malt, and light-moderate wine barrel flavors; with a great malt/yeast/oak balance, and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium carbonation and full body; with a very smooth, creamy/bready, and lightly sticky/chalky/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an insane Belgian strong dark ale! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, dark/bready malt, and light-moderate wine barrel flavors; very smooth and easy to sip on for the big ABV. A really amazing offering.

Mörkt rödbrun med medelstort beiget skum som lägger sig snabbt. I doften finns torkade frukter, aningen rök och jäst. Fyllig smak med mycket torkad frukt och farinsocker, en aning rökighet, lite alkoholeldighet och en bra avslutande beska som balanserar upp fruktsötman. Stor, mjuk, fyllig munkänsla. En riktigt bra belgisk stark.
Taste is of port, oily texture and strong alcohol. Tasted at Gents Bier Festival 2016

Flaska systembolaget. Vintage 2013. Mörkbrun kulör. Lätt julkryddigt doft med torkad frukt och mörk sirap. Smak av övermogna äpplen, jord, sirap, rostad malt och jäst. Sötma som balanseras upp bra av en bitter avslutning. Värmande bröstkänsöa
Very dark brown. Aroma is floral and fruity. Nice texture and body. Pleasant fruity flavour.

On tap @ Beer Revolution. Hazed dark brown beer with a khaki colored head. Sweet dark fruits such as plum, raisin, and cherry. Has a lot of dried berry character. Fairly sweet beer, not surprisingly. Notes of toffee, a touch of charred wood, and plenty of caramel. Nice toasted, bruleed sugar thing, too. Decent mouthfeel and carbonation, but not as nice as what I might expect the bottle to be. Another solid beer of this general style by Struise.
On bottle, pours dark brown, head dissapears quickly though, slight smoked meat smell and taste, chocolate notes and sweetness in the beginning.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours black with Brown head. Aroma is smokey and sweet, with notes of clove and ginger. Taste is a bit smokey with chocolate notes.

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora) U: Donkerbruin met medium donkerbeige schuimkraag die tamelijk snel herleidt wordt naar een kleine schuimring. G: Geroosterde mout, pure chocolade, bruine kandijsuiker, vanille, eik en iets vineus. S: Chocolade in de aanzet, karamelzoetig, gedroogd fruit en geroosterde mout. Rode wijn in de afdronk. M: Iets te veel carbonatie naar mijn smaak, maar al bij al ok. Schitterende degustatiebier, absolute top.

Dark brown with a beige head. Sweet dark malts, red wine, dried overripe fruit, caramel, chocolate, smoke/peat and some coffee. Quite a beast. Way too much winebarrel for me though. The small smokey sensation doesnt seem to fit too. Maybe i should give it some time to mellow down cuz this is way out of balance for my tastebuds.

(330ml 2013 vintage bottle from Systembolaget) Pours very dark brown with a fine pale tan head that lingers with lace. Aroma of molasses, dark toffee, figs, raisins, red wine, oak, slight vanilla, dark bread, spiced notes, smoky, a bit meaty despite the sweetness. Flavour is fundamentally sweet and fruity, similar notes to the aroma with the sugary flavours, bread and fruit being somewhat replaced by oak, vinous notes, tannins and smoky meaty notes in the finish. Light bittering and alcohol heat. Medium full body and fairly soft carb with alcohol hints. Quite complex, really, but from my perspective the smokiness existed in conflict with the other elements as much as in harmony. I would have preferred it a touch more subtle, but the Struise quality is still there.

Dark brown color with a light beige head, quickly diminishing. Aroma has notes of toasted malts, candy sugar, some Belgian yeast. Flavor is slightly sweet, notes of caramel, dry fruits, light sweetness, liquor with wooden hints. Alcoholic mouthfeel in the final with toasted notes.

33cl bottle. 2013 vintage. Dark copper brown color. Thin beige head. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitterness. Medium body. Dry finish. Aroma is roasted, malt, fruit, spices, herbs, smoke, wood, vanilla.

Vintage 2013. Copper, red, ruby color. Clear. Poor quality brown head, vanished completely in just a seconds. Aroma - wine, malts, fruity, caramel, cherry and a bit of wood. Taste is even more sweet in the beginning, but the end is more roasted, toasted. Still sweet though. Perfectly well covered alcohol, not a note of it in taste but in the same time it warms your throat and stomach. Long, pleasant caramel and winey aftertaste. Its a bit to fizzy in the mouth, but its smooth and velvety in the same time. Awesome beer!
De geur is lekker maar een beetje geparfumeerd. De kleur pikzwart. De smaak divers maar niet volledig mijn ding.

Flaska från SB. 2013 vintage. Stor trappist typ Rochefort 10 möter tung rököl och bevisar att mer inte alltid blir bättre. För trots uppenbara kvalitéer som massiv kropp med komplexa smaker av torkad frukt och choklad med fattoner så gör dels rökighetens och dels beskan som är ganska stor att den blir lite tröttsam i längden. Men visst är det bra och i hög grad är det nog att jag inte förväntade mig en sådan smakbild. Maffigt och ja faktiskt riktigt gott också.

Couleur noire, légère mousse beige. Nez chocolat, reglisse, boisé, alcool. Gout caramélisé vieux fruits, malté un peu chocolaté, fruits noirs, reglisse et biscuit. Bon corp. Fin de bouche caramelisée, boisée, alcool avec reglisse, légères épices . De Struise jadore...
Flavours of smoky licorice predominate but the overall impression that it is FAR TOO SWEET.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Bruges. Bottled 15.01.2016. Aroma has sweet malt, licorice and some chocolate. Flavour has raisins, cognac, sweet malty notes, wood and caramel. Good slow sipper.

Aroma: dried fruits, spicy, figs, chocolate, toast, light peach and orange in the background
Taste: medium sweet, spicy, figs, orange, toast, chocolate, prune, caramel

Uit de fles geschonken. Mooi donkerbruin bier. Aromas van mout en rood fruit. Smaken van mout, rood fruit, rook. Zoetig bier met een licht zuurtje door het rode fruit. Mooi volle complexe smaak. Struise FTW!

Flaska från SB, Vintage 2013. Brunsvart, murken vätska med kaffebeiget skum. I doften händer mycket; söta och nötiga toner av torkad frukt och fikon möter rökiga inslag av chark och kaffetoner. Inget tar riktigt över, samtidigt som det inte helt flyter ihop heller. Samsas riktigt snyggt. Inte heller maltigheten går över styr; här finns också en beska som lyckas hävda sig. Lagom stor kropp, om än aningen mindre än jag väntat mig. Även smakmässigt håller den ihop och bevarar komplexiteten på ett snyggt sätt. Här framträder även en relativt stor beska. Vore förstås kul att se vad som händer om en skulle låta den ligga några år...

11.2 oz bottle from Party Source at home. Pours a dark auburn brown color with a small beige head that disappeared. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, caramel, dark fruit, plums, raisins, a subtle smoked character, some alcohol, toffee, good.
Dark brown color. Sweet aromas of caramel and ripe fruits. Taste is the same with added sugar, yeast and some spices. Sweet and spicy finish. Really good.

Bottle at Cotteridge Wines tasting room; shared with evil empire, clear mahogany brown pour with a thin tan head, aroma has dark fruits, light caramel, taste has sweet caramel, candied red fruits, vinous action.
Bottle from SB. Dark reddish brown with a tiny tan head. Fruity and smokey tones. Fruit, malt, sweetness and a hint of smoke. Full body with a long bitter / fruity finish.

pours a murky burgundy. Head is thin and quickly dissipates. NO lacing. The smoke in the aroma surprised me. aroma of charred oak, wet leather, dark fruit, burnt sugars, roasted nuts and blueberries. Sweet, light smoke but not nearly as present as in the aroma. Notes ofoak, roasted nuts, dark fruits, belgium sugars and blueberries. Medium body. Sticky texture. Finish is slightly bitter and the char lasts through it. Not bad but disappointed at the price.

Pours black with a medium foamy tan head. Very nice to look at. Matte black and quite thick. Swirling leaves foamy oily traces on the glass. Aromas of burnt oak, caramel, roasted hazelnuts, cedar, old used smoking pipe, leather, slight red berry notes, muscovado sugar, faint brine. Taste is slightly smoky and salty and somewhat burnt with sweet notes. Reminds me a bit smoked cured meats. Mouthfeel is somewhat creamy and medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Szokásos módon kellemes küllem, sötétbarna testén krémes és lágy, cappuccino-szerű Struise-hab időzik pár percre. Igen különleges, olajos aromák mordulnak fel, komótosan cipelik nehéz molekuláikat, rendkívül telt illatai csemegekosár képét rajzolják a levegőbe. Mustos, aszalt szilvás, karamelles-mazsolás édesség vonalai vegyülnek a sötétebb, földes és kávés, meglepően füstös jegyek halmazával, idővel azonban győzedelmeskedni látszanak az édeskés, likőrös-aszalványos komponensek, az érlelt jelleg intenzív pártfogása azonban mindvégig érvényesülni tud. Robbanékony, lehengerlő ízvilág jellemzi, melyben a füstös jellemvonások kiemelkedő jelentőséggel bírnak, a faháncsos, halványan konyakos, testes vörösboros zamatok marcona kísérőjeként szerepelnek. A cseresznyebefőttes, quadrupelesen diós vonások természetesen szintén ott munkálkodnak, e megszokott jegyeket azonban remekül pezsdíti fel a nem várt, kissé faragatlan, mégis magával ragadó karakter.

F: not very big, brownish, quick gone.
C: dark brown, opaque.
A: malty, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate, molasses, dark fruits, prunes, bready, candy sugar, light smoky and earthy, complex, very pleasant.
T: dark malt, roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, smoky, dry grassy/earthy bitterness, woody tones, dark fruits, raisins, dark cherries, alcohol, complex full body, above average carbonation, very good beer worth to try, Vintage 2013, 0,33l bottle from Malting Pot in Brussels.

341ml bottle at Matts. Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is cherries, dark fruits, roasted malt, caramel. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, cherries. Sour, sweet, dark fruits, roasted malt aftertaste. Very goodml.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2016 330mL bottle, pours a deep dark mahogany / brown with a small beige head. Aroma brings out light earthy smoke, bready notes and slight toasted caramel. Flavour is unusual, with an earthy smokiness upfront, followed by caramel and toasted bread. Unique and quite complex, though doesnt seem as elegant as the ratings suggest. Very nice stuff.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget, vintage 2013. Deep dark brown with a tanned head, some lacing. Sweet and vinous aroma, light roasted and smoky notes, red wine, cherry, chocolate, raisins, mildly spicy. Full-bodied, soft, silky mouthfeel, mildly carbonated. Creamy and sweet taste, roasted malt, caramel, dark sugar, dried fruit, dark bread and chocolate. A lot of sweetness but also earthy and peppery with warming alcohol notes of red wine, dark rum and oak barrels. Long warming finish.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy dark fruit aroma. Sweetish malty spicy dark fruit and caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty spicy caramel and dark fruit finish.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is very dark brown to black colored and has an unstable creamy head, with enough carbonation.
The aroma is roasted malts and caramel, but also has notes of figs, dark fruits, candy, vanilla, wood and some coffee and cacao. 
The taste is full bodied and sweet and the tones from the aroma are well noticable. Its a little like a port and it changes into a bitterness with tones of smoke, coffee and cacao.
The finish is warming alcohol and also has a light bitterness and dryness. 
This beer is more an Imperial Stout for me than a Strong Ale, very nicely done.

Really awesome beer I think. Great full bodied and full flavored with a really great distant smokiness in the aroma. Fantastic complex taste with raisins and prunes etc present and the subtle smokiness. Really good stuff!

Mørk mørk brun med fingerhøyt lys brunt skum. Søtlig lukt, vanilje, melkesjokolade, trevirke og svisker. Middels fylde. Søtlig smak, tørket frukt, noe røkt smak er også i denne, noe salt lakris, solbær og lett bitterhet i avsluttningen.

330ml bottle from LAbbaye Des Saveurs, Lille. Pours dark mahogany with small tan head. Aroma is lovely dark caramel / candi sugar with added woody warmth. Taste really takes this character into wonderful complex depths, unexpected smoky notes take precedent before some vinous red wine notes mingling with some deep caramel quad flavours. Very nice.

Csodálatos barna nedű, magasra tornyosuló bézs habbal. Ízében és illatában a csokoládé, aszalt gyümölcsök, némi gyógynövényes-hordós jegyek, illetve enyhe pörkölt jegyek játszanak. Csodálatos sör, öröm és élvezet minden kortya.
Bottle. Dark brown pour with a fleeting off white head. Christmas spice aromas. Taste follows suit with some bitter almost astringent coffee back beats. Average body and mouthfeel.

Bottle at home, 19th June 16. Very dark brown. Aroma is brown sugar, dark fruit, molasses. Taste is brown sugar sweet, slight liquorice, candy, molasses, dark sweet overripe fruit. Nice, although slightly too sweet.
Bottled:Pours black with ruby highlights. Medium to small head.Aroma of smoked ham and toffee.Smooth, somewhat sticky mouthfeel.Taste is sweet with notes of smoke and peat. Some booze in the finish.

Bottle. Pours deep brown to black with a small, creamy, beige head. Aroma has smoked wood, raisins, chocolate, plenty of plums, figs and dates. Vanilla and a slight peppery touch. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet fat maltiness, raisins, dates, chocolate. Oaky dryness, vanilla. Light smoky edge. Fine, lingering bitterness.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Smell of dried fruits and dark malts. Similar taste with a spicy aroma and roasted sugar. Sweet but the body wasnt that thick.
Dark, no head. Strong in alcohol. Flavor of coffee, resin, dried fruit and molasses. Much too sweet.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A very dark brown opaque beer with a medium beige head ; poor retention. Roast, wood, whisky, peat, herb, alcohol. Medium sweet, round, warming atmosphere, light dry bitter. Full body, thin tetxure, soft carbonation, sweet warming finish. Overall, a really good strong belgian ale ; pleasant peat woody aroma.
Brun /svart med ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar kaffe, russin vanilj och torkad frukt. Lite fatlagring? riktigt bra! !

Bottle from De Struise, Oostvleteren - BE. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: roasted malt, caramel and coffee notes. Mocha and wine notes. Taste: full body with high roasted sweet malt. Caramel notes and coffee presence. Very intensive taste. Mocha. Good attenuation. Alcohol finish. Aftertaste: coffee and mocha. Alcohol notes. Raisin finish.
pours dark Brown, clear. Small white head. Smell is sweet, dark malts, some barrel. Taste is intense, dark grainy. Sweet, red wine , oak. Very intense, perfect mouthfeel .

@ Havregatan 20160610. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. [ Vintage 2013 ]. Malty, fruity and caramely, yeasty and light woody, overripe fruits with light spicy estery notes, sweet, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter and sweet with overripe fruits, light alcoholic notes and light woody notes.

Pours dark brown with low off white head
Aromas of liqourize, hints smoke, oak, muscavado, hints of dried fruits
Taste has rich notes of liqourize, oak, leather, smoke, wood, muscavado, dried fruits, viol, pepper
Mouthfeel is medium bodied, low bitterness, medium carbonation, medium to high sweetness
bottle 2013 scura discreta schiuma buona persistenza frutta matura candite lieve tostute morbida

Ap: Bruin met rode schijn, 
Aroma : caramel, licht geroosterd, donker fruit,
Smaak: licht geroosterde, caramel, donker fruit, rode wijn, alcohol meer aanwezig dan meeste Struise producten, zoete brood?
Pallet: lichter dan verwacht.

Bottle. Light hazy deep brown liquid with small to medium light tan head. Aroma of red berries, vanilla, dried fruit, jenka, wood and light grain. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, toffee, raisins, caramel and light grain. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Nice!

Bottled. Pours hazy deep brown with a red glow and a small beige head, Aroma of slightly toasted malts, caramel, overripe fruits and toffee. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and with some alcohol too. Medium to full bodied, oily to syrupy texture and soft carbonation. A very nice nice Belgian Ale. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottled from Systembolaget
Dark brown with almost no head. 
Fruity, vinous aroma with lychee and diet. 
Sweet and vinous flavour with dates, lychee and caramel.

Nice beer. Dark brown, decent head. Well developed, well aged. Raisin, Port wine, brown malts. Very well rounded off classic Belgian dark ale, very yummy. Pricy but worth it. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière I think)

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, 2013 vintage, bottled in January 2016. Clear, very dark ruby with a thin, frothy, almost stable, beige head. Sweetish-malty, a little fruity and relatively spicy aroma of raisins, caramel, cinnamon, coriander seeds, maybe a touch of red wine and some oak. Sweet, malty, slightly fruity and a little spicy taste of caramel, raisins, red wine, cinnamon and oak, followed by a long, slightly vinous, rather warming and a quite yeasty-spicy finish. Medium to full body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. The taste is more impressive than the aroma, and all in all this is a very decent sipper. I am not sure what the critics expect from a beer only because it is made by Struise, I really like it though.

Butelka 0,33. Receptura amerykańskiego piwowara ale piwo warzone w Belgii. Smakowo coś pomiędzy angielskim barley wine a quadruplem. Piana obfita, ciemna, szybko opadająca. Piwo mocne, wyraziste, słodowe, nuty suszonych owoców i przypraw znakomicie skontrowane odbeczkową wanilią. Ułożenie, harmonia na poziomie najlepszych belgów, świetne piwo.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2016 Bottle, 2013 vintage, pours dark brown with ruby notes and a beige head. Fairly boozy aroma with red wine, wood, yeasty notes, molasses, candy sugar. Sweet with a decent bitterness, oily texture, medium body. Red wine barrel astringency with candy sugar, dark fruit, liquorice, clove, fairly boozy. Nice, but not quite as good as expected.

330ML bottle from Saveur Biére - Very dark brown body, with a lasting tan head. Nose of roasted malts, dark chocolate, dried cake fruit, brandy, caramel, and molasses. The taste follows the same notes, with the dried fruit, chocolate and caramel coming to the fore.. Smooth texture, medium to full body and a sticky-sweet and slightly smoky aftertaste. Indulgent.

330ml bottle from SB.
Dark muddy brown with sediment and a 2 finger sized tanned spongy head.
Raisins, molasses, some smoke, cognac, dark bread, gluey alcohol. Rich and complex aroma.
Taste is sweet malty and yeasty with complex alcohols, raisins and plum, chocolate and burnt sugar, slight licorice and cognac, some dark fruit acidity that freshens the flavour, spicy nutty alcoholic finish.
Full bodied with fairly frisk carbonation that gives it a lighter feel than it actually has, oily texture. After a while the carbonation fades and it gets thicker and oilier.
Very nice big complex beer. Could do with some age to mellow the alcohol and the carbonation, but its nice now as well.
330ml bottle. Dark mahogany, nearly black, body with a low white head. Fruit, berries, alcohol, spices.

Bottle from Chez Alain in Rennes France... Pours deep mahogany with rapidly dissipating beige head. Notes of fig, dried fruit, cardamon, clove, Apple and port wine. Flavors are layered complex and delicious. Another solid Pannepot variation...
Bottle. Complex and drinkable strong ale with notes of clove, toffee, milk chocolate and a tiny smokieness. Nice soft mouthfeel.

330 ml 2013 bottle bought at HK Brewcraft in Central.
Looks: Opague Cola brown colour with a thin layer of yeast sediments; Very thin head with residual light beige foam which fades in 15 seconds. Fair sticky lacing with near zero carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant dark malt, with strong barrel, red wine, vanilla, strong caramel, sticky toffee, dark fruits, dark chocolate, coffee, cream, sugar, spices, strong Bel yeast, biscuits, lemon and light grass. Complex and nice!

Taste: Strong sweet dark malt, with caramel, dark fruits, light toffee, strong alcohol, red wine, barrel, red fruits, coffee, nice syrup, spices, strong Bel yeast, lime cordial, close to medium bitter hops and grass.

Body: Full body. Very slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Fairly good dark maltyness in a slightly thick ground. Slick and very nice sugar syrup hits first, followed by layers of red wine, caramel, coffee, red fruits, strong booze, dark fruits and spices spinning around. Lime cordial to round, complex and really nice!

Booze: the 10% is slightly warming even in sips, but combined with the tasty syrup and red wine barrel almost perfectly. Treat it with respect and youll have a neat session!

Hoppiness: Lemon and light grassin nose. Lime cordial and grass in taste; Bitterness is mostly from liquorices for a lasting, close to mid astringent sweet malty finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry. Vinous and sweet boozy to mouth.

Comments: This one is just as strong and dark as most Struise Ales, with a remarkably red winey character to grace its complex aroma and taste. Its also strongly sweet but in a very pleasant way, work so well with toffee and chocolate-like dark maltyness. Definitely a cellar material for better tasting with age. Highly recommended!

ABV: 10% Bottled December 2013. Best before November 2029. 
A version of Pannepot stored at Margaux barrels - This cant go wrong! 

Serving temperature: 12.5C (54.5F) - A little too cold. 
Music to this beer; of course Thelonious Monk - Round Midnight and the beautiful Ruby, My Dear. 

Very dark brown beer with a thin, creamy mocha colored head that sinks down to 2 mm and stays forever! 
Little lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Dark dried fruit, raisin, prune, caramel, vanilla, spices, a hint of smoke, syrup and gingerbread. 
As the beer heats up (now 16C, 61F) the aroma explodes! I now also get chocolate, red berries, more ginger and charcuterie. 
Taste: Ohhh... i just LOVE Struise! Soft, creamy taste of caramel malt, slightly roasted, raisin, oak, vanilla, dark bread, a slight tartness, coffee and alcohol. 
Mouth: Full body. Light and soft carbonation. Deep complex structure with sweetness balancing the oak barrel strength. 

Pure love!

Vintage 2013. Dark brown colour. Medium, white head. Hints of berries, hints if dark fruits, plums, hints of wine or cognac, toffee, bready notes in the aroma. Rich! Dark fruits, hints of coffee, hints of berries. Toffee in the middle. Cognacy or liqeury notes. Hints of cocoa, slight caramel and alcohol in the end. Some bitterness and notes of chocolate with slight alcohol in the aftertaste. Really well balanced, rich, rather heavy bodied but well drinkable amazing beer. The sweetness and the barrel strenght are in balance as well as every other adpect of this beer.

Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget, 2013 vintage. Black with a brown head. Smokey, leather, blueberries, hint of tartness, roasty, syrup. Berries, fruity, more smoke, raisins, some tartness, sweetness. Full/medium body, low carbonation, smokey sweet tart finish. Interesting beer!

Campfire, leather, rye bread, dark syrup aroma. Sweet taste, bit chocolatey, raisins. Long lasting finish with dark chocolate and coffee. This is a really nice beer. Complex but still somewhat sessionable.

Bottle from a friend (2013). Brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, nuts, smoke, banana, ripe fruits and chocolate. Bitter finish with citrus, nuts, smoke, banana, chocolate and ripe fruits. Excellent brew.
Pours deep brown with near flat head. Aroma of hazelnut, brown sugar, dates and figs, light herbs. Taste is sweet, slightly funky, complex. Light to medium bodied and smooth with soft carbonation.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Joes. Dark red-brown color, small to average sized beige head that diminishes fairly quickly. Aroma is malts, caramel, sweetish overripe fruits. Tastes about the same: malts, brown malts, caramel, brown candy sugar, a quite firm smoky touch, sweet. Decent to medium body and carbonation. Hmm ok, decent.

Bottle (2013 vintage) @ benzai. Dark brown colour with no real head. Smells alcohol, malts, dark malts, plums, raisins. Tastes sweet, slightly smokey, alcohol, slightly salty. Medium to full body, soft carbo.
Brunsvart öl med ett lättare beige skum. Doften är kryddig med fikon, sviskon och alkohol. I smaken är alkoholen mindre framträdande. Mer fruktiga inslag tillsammans med lakrits.
Bottle at Nuetnigenough. Pours dark browm with a tan head. Smoky malty aroma. Med ++ body. Flavor is smoky dark malt with a sort of sour mash aspect. Not dry, not really bitter. Quite tasty.
Bottle from Nuetnigenogh. Pours near black with an attractive tan head and a smoky treacle aroma. There is a rich chocolate and dark molasses flavor with a fruity finish.

15/05/2016 @home - 33cl bottle from Bierhyalle Deconinck, Vichte.
Murky brown colour with creamy beige yellowish head. Nose is dried fruits, mocha, tobacco, hints of leather. Taste is very complex. Dried fruits, caramel, mocha, tobacco, definetly vintage but in a nice way, light bitter ending. Very nice MF. Top! Im a fan. May even get more if I taste it again.

roasty, caramel, chocolate, butterscotch alcohol, herbs, Brown sugar, floral.
Murky Brown colour, small tan head.
Salty, roasty, heavy sweetness, medium bite, very warming.
Fullbodied, average carbonation, salty and roasty finish.

2013 Vintage. Lot 12.10.2013. Bottled 15.01.2016. A very dark brown beer, a head is small and beige. Aroma has strong and rich dark fruitness, prunes, raisins, some port wine and cherries, earthyness and barrel. Taste has dark fruits, prunes, cherries, quite low sweetness, some spices, quite fresh. Medium+ bodied, smooth and pleasant palate. The dark fruity, fresh enough, high-quality beer.

Bottle from web SB cons 2016-05-14 Göteborg
AR: brittish fruit cake, rasins, pruns, fruits sought in alcholic
AP: dark brown ruby, stouty dark beige lid
F: vinos, brittish fruit cake, pruns, rasins, medium carbonation, sweet, warming feeling,

Smells nice, not a looker, dishwaterish...
Taste is exellent, lots of coffee flavour, dry, smooth
A real sipper..
Bottle. Muddy. Dark brown color with small creamy white mostly lasting head. Aroma is roasted malt with notes of licorice, coffee, and Dark fruits. Strong spicy flavor . Creamy palate.

Bottle 2013 reserva. Deep dark brown with red nuance, beige quickly dissipating foam. Aroma is thick, strong with banana, cocoa, dark rye bread, sweet malt close to vanilla, slight berry and red winey tones. Taste had a huge malty ground, lots of sweet and dark bready notes paired with a barrel note of wine, berries and coffee, slight smokey note, finishes with creamy coffee, barrel notes and a warm alcohol note. Big body, low carbo. Excellent.

W aromacie początkowo doskonała beczka, wanilia, bourbon, potem dochodzą suszone owoce, karmel, rodzynki, ciemne ciasto. W smaku podobnie, suszone owoce, drewno, wanilia, ciasto, przebłyski mlecznej czekolady, rodzynki, cukier kandyzowany. Gładkie, świetnie ukryty alkohol. Do pełni szczęścia brakowało ciut więcej pełni i więcej akcentów czerwonych owoców

Vintage 2013, 33 cl. imbottigliata il 15/01/2016, lotto 110129121013, aperta il 10/05/2016.
Tonaca di frate molto scura, quasi nera, con riflessi granata e giallastri, schiuma beige di buona persistenza.
Aroma di cacao, anice, caramello, banana matura, datteri, vinosa, metallica, note legnose e di amarena.
Al palato attacca dolce e vinosa, sempre banana matura edatteri, uva e leggera amarena, caramello, successivamente un bel finale molto lungo di cacao smorzato da una lieve coda erbacea mista a note legnose e vinose.
Corpo medio, mediamente carbonata.

330 ml bottle. 2013 vintage. Pours a very dark brown with a full foamy tannish head. Aromas of spice, raisins, wet bread crusts, earth and light smoke. Flavors follow same with notable Belgian yeast and a bit of copper. Very nice

2013 Special Reserve. Pours dark brown with a finger of khaki head. Thick, slightly boosy nose with lots of dark rye bread, belgo yeast, a hint of wet dog and some dried fruits. The palate is balanced, elegant for the style, medium bodied and semi-sweet with good malt base and low bitterness. A very nice example of the style, although perhaps not as spectacular as the Pannepot-series from the same brewery

Aroma: Coffee, dried dark fruits, roast, wood, hint of chocolate, red berries Appearance: Dark brown, red glow, thick big bubble beige quickly disappearing head, light lace Taste: Coffee, dark cherry, roast wood, dried dark fruits

Dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma is raisins, brown sugar, dates, prunes, anise, Belgian yeast. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel, rich on the palate with a slightly hot finish. Taste is prunes, figs, raisins, brown sugar, oak, hint of red wine. This will age nicely.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka "vintage 2013" (z kapsla wynika, ze z grudnia). Niezbyt trwala choc ladna piana, oleiste przy nalewaniu, prawie czarne piwo. Aromaty: Marcepan. Pralinki. Figi/Rodzynki/Sliwki - suszone/kandyzowane. Melasa. Wanilia. Czekolada. Jakies korzenne klimaty. Duzo tego, intensywnie, zlozone. W ustach lepkawe, z wyczuwalnym alkoholem (szlachetnym, i de facto spelniajacym role goryczki - to piwo zalepiloby slodycza bez alkoholu). Slodkie. Poszczypujace wysycenie (mimo, ze niskie). Niby degustacyjne piwo, a reka sama siega po pokal, zeby wziac nastepny lyk. Super.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Creamy head. Clear dark ruby body.
Nose of raisin, some white wine, prunes, a light butter tone, bread and even some olives... Not much else...
Flavour is not special at all, very typical: prunes, raisin, alcohol, bread, malts, sweets like brown sugars, some caraeml... Very typical. Have had it many times before...
Aftertaste is bitter, raisn, bread and caramel ish tones.
Low carbo, creamy close to silky mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Why oh why? Lots of minus points as this is seriously a big fail because it does not contribute to a damn thing I expected this to be!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Very sweet sugary fruity aroma. Like a good quad. Smoky malts sweet dark fruit. Really interesting beer! These Struise motherfuckers are the best! Light and huge flavor. Totally bomb!

Bottle at Craigs. Pours dark ruby brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of red wine, chocolate, wood. Taste is fruity, wood. Barrel finish.

Flaska från Saveur Bieré. Vintage 2013. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, mörk torkad frukt, jäst, övermogna päron med toner av trä, choklad, marsipan, grön banan och portvin. Fruktig, komplex, smakrik, stor sötma, fin beska. Mycket, mycket gott!

Bouteille 33cl, BB 11/01/2029.
Brune foncée, col crémeux blanc-cassé.
Arôme au rétro fruité noir, sucre brun, malt grillé, toffee, léger biscuité avec un bouquet très Struise dans lapproche et un que je retrouve dans les bières fortes brunes de Deca.
Palais est malté, fines épices, caramel avec un léger biscuité sorte de barrique en fin de bouche - vin et fruité noir. Petite note épicée rappelant la réglisse. Garde une petite similitude avec Pannepot et au final, cest dommage que si peu de Struise se retrouve en bouteille sur le marché belge.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2016 Bottle at csakajosor. Very dark brown colour with a small brown head. Nose of ripe banans with some very faint smoke. Taste is low bitterness low sweetness. Distinct banana and smoke. Strange but good.
Dark brown colour, beige foam, stays long. Aroma of caramel and dark fruit. Some banana. Bitter hoppy finish. Good and drinkable but I expected more.
33 cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is overripe fruity. Sweet, caramelish, toasted and sweet. Smooth caramelish. Lingering phenolic and toasted malty, caramelish finish.

dark brown colour, medium sized creamy beige hed; aroma of dried plum,some dates and raisins, chocolate, biscuit, hints of rye bread, woody and ash notes some herbs and hints of smoke (smoked cheese?); taste of very well balanced chocolate and dried fruits (cherry, plum and dates), oak barrel notes, herbal liqueur minimal smoke again and slight sourness similarly to other Struise beers; just simply amazing!
2013 vintage. Absolutely excellent. Very smooth with balanced sweetness. No obvious ester flavour which I assume is due to age.
Clear dark ruby, light brown lasting, lascing foam head. Light sweet caramel, fruity tones, pear. Light bitter taste, some sweet ntes, fruity again. Great brew. (Velp 201604)

33 cl bottle. 2013 vintage.
Pours dark mahogany red color with a small off-white head. Lots of sweet and ripe fruits on the nose, mild caramel, malts, mild sugar candy and yeast, subtle alcohol notes come through also. Sweet sugary and malty flavor, some wooden notes, spices, yeast, bitterness, mild alcohol burn at the end. Theres also some weird harsh grassy and earthy notes that ruin the flavor a bit, slightly metallic too. A big disappointment.
5434

33cl bottle.
Appearance: Clear dark brown beer, beige to brown creamy head. Head leaves some lacing spots Aroma: sweet dried fruits, some banana, caramel, win, earthy tones, a hint oi ash, spices, 
Taste: sweet starter with caramel and fruit, luckilly some sourness, earthy tones, ash, wood akick in. Quite some alcohol, but the taste palate and body can handle it.. Aftertaste: alcohol, chocolate, little sour, dried fruits, some caramel.
soft carbonation, full body. 

Finally a new great Struise beer, after the last beers, wich I had were a bit dissapointing.

Had it several times and not sure why I didnt rate it yet. Since I have to do it by memory Im gonna give only some impressions : well rounded deep toffee, dried raisin and plum, some candied fruits and delicate alcohol. Medium thick with delicate carbonation. Well balanced sweetness with notes of fruit cake and spiced bread. Really great beer.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2016 Bottle at HBF2016. Dark brown color, vanishing head. Caramel, alcohol, toffee in the nose. Full-bodied. Toffee, fruits, alcohol, raisins, syrupy, some toasted malts. Slow dessert beer.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2016 330ml bottle @ HBF 2016. Pours dark brown with a tiny head. Aroma of malts, syrup and toffee. Taste is boozy, malty and syrupy with some ripe fruits, plum and yeastiness. Finish is malty, caramely and syrupy with some ripe fruits and plum. A bit unbalanced and boozy.
Bottle @ hbf 2016. Deep brown, thin off white head. Raisins, plums, hops. Caramel. Awesome balance. Warming. Some bread as well. Dark fruits. Warming alcohol. Excellent.

2013 vintage. Pours a dark brown producing a large fluffy tan head. Aroma of dates and raisins. Sugary. Complex taste. Its light sweet, has a vinous touch with hints of red wine grapes and a long fruity finish. Abit warming as well. Full bodied and just above avg co2 levels.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dried fruit, Belgian yeast, wood, vanilla and chocolate.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown with a slight/medium beige/brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dried fruit, Belgian yeast, wood, vanilla and chocolate.
Bottle.Color hazy amber with medium head. Aroma alcohol, fruits, sweet, caramel. Taste sweet, alcohol, sugar, fruits, spicy.

April 7, 2016. Bottle, bottled October 12, 2013 (marked 121013). 
Dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet malty with caramel, dark sugars, notes of raisins, light spicy, some smoked notes and a touch of higher alcohols. Taste is quite sweet, malty, soft slightly burnt bitterness, some smokiness. Finish is slightly boozy with a note of higher alcohol, sweet malty caramel and dried fruit notes, the alcohol, smoke and very light sourish touch gives it a slight harshness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. 
Good, but not in the same league as other similar offerings from De Struise.

15/II/16 - 33cl bottle @ Struise Schooltje (FIRST! But didnt take notes.) and 27/III/16 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a (2016-293) Thanks to Urbain for letting me have the scoop of the bottled version on my birthday!
Clear dark brown beer, beige to brown creamy head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet, lots of dried fruits, some banana, caramel, chocolate, bit earthy, some spices. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet start, caramel, sourish touch, earthy, lots of alcohol, dried fruits, soft roast. Aftertaste: alcohol, chocolate, little sour, more dried fruits, some caramel.

Bottle bought at Geers Oostakker.
Pours black with a medium beige head. Wine feeling, black current, dried fruits, butterscotch, smokey touch, wood, vanilla, chocolate, hops.
Bottle (33 cl) from bieresgourmet.be. Dark brown, beige head. Sugary, caramelly aroma, slightly roasted with some smoked notes. Full bodied, high carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 33cl bottle, served in snifter glass. This poured a very dark reddish brown with a small light brown head. Wonderful aromas of raisins, vanilla, dark fruit, caramelized creme brulee, roasted malts. Taste: Oooooh that is dilicious! Very vinous portlike qualities with earthy dark fruits, toasted bread, vanilla, spices, dark chocolate, coffee, butterscotch, cherries, licorice, woody nuts. A medium to full body with a vinous, sticky and smoky sweet finish. Alcohol is hidden well. Overall another deliciously tasting brew by the gentlemen from Oostvleteren and a very fitting ode to Thelonious Monk! All Hail De Struise Brouwers!

2013 - 33cl, 10%, schenkt bruin/rood met beperkt licht kaki kraag. aroma van donkere fruitsoorten (rozijn en pruim), caramel, moutig, Belgische gist, redelijk zoet, maar ook hout, gerookte mout, ham. Smaken zijn zwaar zoet, weeïge mout, veel rookmout, vanille, alcohol, donker fruit (rozijn, pruim), matige/redelijk body, lage co2, zoeter weeïge rookmou/ha, afdronk. nee vind dit nou niet een ideale combinatie.

Bottled in Frape. Color is deep hazy brown color with average beige head. Licorice nose. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel. Flavour is same with more body and bit of alcohol.Finishes with a nice alcoholic bitterness.

33cl bottle. Pours a very dark brown, with a medium height tan head that gives way to a thin, velvety tan head. Smells of roasted malts, smoked malts, dark chocolate, dark and dried fruit, whiskey, caramel, molasses. The taste follows the same notes, with emphasis on the dried fruit, chocolate and caramel, as is the case with most quads. Smooth texture, medium to full body and a sticky-sweet and slightly smoky aftertaste.

Rating #1118, flaske fra The Bottle Shop i Brügge  

Meget mørkebrun øl med luftigt gulligt skum der forsvinder lidt efter lidt. En kraftigt maltet og frugtig aroma breder sig langt væk fra glasset, og ved nærmere indsnusning afsløres en perlerække af svesker, rosiner, let kaffe, brombær og brændt malt. Dejligt sød og ristet smag med dadler, rosiner, ristet malt, træ og en brændende alkohol. Medium bitter der tangerer henimod det beske. Smagen slutter lidt abrupt og virker lidt tam i forhold til den komplekse duft. Mundfølelsen er helt i top: Silkeblød men ikke tynd øl med moderat kulsyre. Alt i alt en øl med mange spændende elementer, men den halter lidt på selve smagsoplevelsen.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Bottle at home. Nice reddish brown, dark colour, quite a big foamy light brown head. Struise-style complexity in the nose and taste with red wine/porto, dried and ripe fruits, caramel, molasses, herbal, some distant vanilla/cask tones, lightly bitter, rather alcoholic in the finish. UPDATED: MAR 27, 2016 New Struise quadrupel named after a Thelonious Monk jazz standard - and when Urbain does a new quad, the beer geek world knows about it, as this beer has been receiving tons of attention lately. Medium thick, pale yellowish beige, lightly lacing, moussy head dissipating in the middle but otherwise well retaining; burgundy robe with wine red hue, hazy, very dark but still translucent. Rich bouquet of everything a good quadrupel (or abt) should offer: a ton of brown sugar, toffee, ripe banana (but not in the bubblegum way), cherry bonbons, maple syrup, cashew nuts, ruby port, some subtle vanilla, something vaguely soapy (lavender almost), candied fig, honey-glazed spare ribs, marzipan, toasted bread, chamomille, something subtly meaty, hint liquorish candy, cake dough, pear, brown rum, unmistakable fresh paint solvents but well hidden in all these other odours, lovely whiff of oak bringing it all together without becoming too intrusive but gaining strength as it warms up (and so does the meaty factor, by the way). Quite heavy onset of overripe peach, fig and dried banana with a lot of candi sugar sweetness on top but a deep basic sourishness for balance as well, though the sweetness dominates, along with unmistakably meaty umami flavors. Soft carbo, big and thick but soft and fluffy mouthfeel, bit resinous; thick layer of sweet caramelly and bittersweet toasted maltiness ensues, while the initial dark sugar and beautifully restrained fruit sweetness continue, all leading to a very satisfying, rich finish, malt and brown sugar sweet with becoming cloying, as this sweetness is balanced by a late, earthy, lightly peppery hop bitterness, a drying oaky effect which remains subtle and discreet, and the expected glow of warming, yet non-astringent, rum-like alcohol. It is good to see that Struise has reconnected with its own past in searching for the perfect quadrupel - after a whole bunch of Pannepot variations, this one is indeed a bit different, more straightforward perhaps, and definitely sweeter. One for those who like their quads sweet and opulent - I can recommend this to e.g. adepts of Rochefort 10 and the like. Interesting, overpowering beer, Struise did it again, though to me it does not quite reach the levels of the best of the Pannepot family. Still, Id sure like to see what becomes of this after five years of cellaring, must prove really interesting...
